meanings.definition: To move or shoot suddenly and rapidly in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit will dartle away when it hears a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: She likes to dartle across the field when playing tag.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel dartled up the tree to escape the barking dog.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes dartled around the room, searching for her lost keys.
meanings.sent5: The lightning dartled across the sky, illuminating the dark clouds.

meanings.definition: A sudden quick movement or throw.
meanings.sent1: He caught the dartle of the baseball just in time.
meanings.sent2: The dartle of the fish in the water caught her attention.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected dartle of the cat made her jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: She felt a dartle of excitement when she saw her favorite band live.
meanings.sent5: The dartle of the paper airplane across the room was impressive.
